item.title: Chantaal add a quote by David Mitchell
item.description: "Me, <i>I</i> want to bloody kick this <i>moronic bloody</i> world in the bloody <i>teeth</i> over and over till it bloody <i>understands</i> that <i>not hurting people</i> is ten bloody <i>thousand</i> times more bloody important than being <i>right</i>." -- David Mitchell

item.title: Chantaal add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Chantaal add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Chantaal add a quote by Ken Kesey
item.description: "Man, when you lose your laugh you lose your footing." -- Ken Kesey

item.title: Chantaal add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Chantaal add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Chantaal add a quote by Allen Saunders
item.description: "Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans." -- Allen Saunders

item.title: Chantaal add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Chantaal add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Chantaal add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Chantaal add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Chantaal add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Chantaal add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Chantaal add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Without music, life would be a mistake." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Chantaal add a quote by Gustave Flaubert
item.description: "Do not read, as children do, to amuse yourself, or like the ambitious, for the purpose of instruction. No, read in order to live." -- Gustave Flaubert

item.title: Chantaal add a quote by Frederick Douglass
item.description: "Once you learn to read, you will be forever free." -- Frederick Douglass

item.title: Chantaal add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "She is too fond of books, and it has turned her brain." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Chantaal add a quote by Gail Carson Levine
item.description: "A library is infinity under a roof." -- Gail Carson Levine

item.title: Chantaal add a quote by J.M. Barrie
item.description: "To die would be an awfully big adventure." -- J.M. Barrie

item.title: Chantaal add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "The man in black fled across the desert, and the gunslinger followed." -- Stephen King

item.title: Chantaal add a quote by Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "When you have eliminated all which is impossible, then whatever remains, however improbable, must be the truth." -- Arthur Conan Doyle

item.title: Chantaal add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "After all, reading is arguably a far more creative and imaginative process than writing; when the reader creates emotion in their head, or the colors of the sky during the setting sun, or the smell of a warm summer's breeze on their face, they should reserve as much praise for themselves as they do for the writer - perhaps more." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Chantaal add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Chantaal add a quote by David Mitchell
item.description: "A half-read book is a half-finished love affair." -- David Mitchell

item.title: Chantaal add a quote by David Mitchell
item.description: "We are only what we know, and I wished to be so much more than I was, sorely." -- David Mitchell

item.title: Chantaal add a quote by David Mitchell
item.description: "Power, time, gravity, love. The forces that really kick ass are all invisible." -- David Mitchell

item.title: Chantaal add a quote by Gore Vidal
item.description: "The unfed mind devours itself." -- Gore Vidal

item.title: Chantaal add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Chantaal add a quote by David Mitchell
item.description: "My life amounts to no more than one drop in a limitless ocean. Yet what is any ocean, but a multitude of drops?" -- David Mitchell

item.title: Chantaal add a quote by David Mitchell
item.description: "Our lives are not our own. We are bound to others, past and present, and by each crime and every kindness, we birth our future." -- David Mitchell
